com.biomatters.geneious.publicapi.plugin

Class GeneiousPlugin

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.biomatters.geneious.publicapi.plugin.GeneiousPlugin

  • public abstract class GeneiousPlugin
extends Object
    The base class for all Geneious plugins.

    Adding Functionality

    Plugins provide functionality to Geneious through a set of get methods:
    • getServices()
    • getDocumentOperations()
    • getDocumentFileImporters()
    • getDocumentFileExporters()
    • getDocumentViewerFactories()
    • getDocumentActions()
    • getSequenceAnnotationGenerators()
    • getSequenceGraphFactories()
    Each of these methods returns a list of objects representing the actions that the plugin can perform.
    The easiest way to return the lists is to use anonymous inner classes, for example to return a single DocumentOperation you would use:

    return new DocumentOperation[] {new DocumentOperation{ public void methodName(){} ... }}

    This abstract class has default implementations returning the appropriate empty/none/null value for each of the above get methods.

    If your plugin has a number of importers/exporters and operations you may want to store them in separate java files.
    see the documentation for each operation class for information about how to implement each class

    Warning: When Geneious installs a plugin, it does so in a non-AWT thread. A plugin may not execute any swing/user interface code in response to any of the functions that Geneious may call in this class.

      • getName

        public abstract String getName()
        Name of the plugin suitable for usage in user interface or logs.
        Returns:
        plugin name. Cannot be null

      • getDescription

        public abstract String getDescription()
        A short description of the plugins purpose.
        Returns:
        plugin description. Cannot be null

      • getHelp

        public abstract String getHelp()
        Help for this plugin in the form of HTML or plain text.
        Returns:
        A help text for this plugin in HTML or plain text. May return null. This text may appear in the help panel within geneious, in the online manual etc.

      • getAuthors

        public abstract String getAuthors()
        A list of the authors of this module.
        Returns:
        author list. Cannot be null

      • getEmailAddressForCrashes

        public String getEmailAddressForCrashes()
        Returns an email address that any crashes that Geneious thinks are likely to be caused by this plugin should be sent to. The standard Geneious error dialog will still be displayed, and if the user clicks submit it will be sent to the Geneious server, grouped with similar crashes and emailed to the specified email address.

        The default implementation returns null which means crash reports will be sent to Biomatters.

        Returns:
        An email address for any crash reports to be sent to for this plugin or null to send them to Biomatters.

      • getVersion

        public abstract String getVersion()
        Version number of this plugin. Must be of the form x[.y[.z]] where x,y,z are a positive integers. e.g 0.1 or 1.0 or 1.0.1 or 1.0.12 or 1.1 Versions are compared numerically based on the first non-equal integer encountered. For example, 1.1 is higher than 1.0.12
        Returns:
        version number. Cannot be null

      • initialize

        public void initialize(File pluginUserDirectory,
              File pluginDirectory)
        An initialization method which plugins should override to obtain the plugin's installation directory and a user writable directory.

        This method is guaranteed to be the first call after creation of plugin via its empty constructor. The plugin should return quickly from this method. If it needs to perform expensive operations it should do so in a separate thread.

        A plugin (or even Geneious itself) is not necessarily able to modify a plugin's data files (those in pluginDirectory at runtime. For example, Geneious and various plugins could have been installed for all users on the machine, and individual users don't (and shouldn't) have write access to the plugin data files. The pluginUserDirectory is guaranteed to be writable and unique for each user.

        Parameters:
        pluginUserDirectory - A user writable per plugin directory where the plugin can store data that will persist after restarting Geneious. This directory will not necessarily exist. A plugin should create it if necessary using File.mkdir(). If a plugin needs to create temporary files it should use FileUtilities.createTempFile instead.
        pluginDirectory - Location (Directory) where plugin jar file is located. Used by plugins requiring access to additional files (executables, data) which are external to the java code. This is null for internal plugins which have no such directory.
        See Also:
        GeneiousService.initializeService(GeneiousServiceListener)

      • getServices

        public GeneiousService[] getServices()
        A plugin may provides a set of services. Should return an empty list if none.
        Returns:
        A list of services.

      • getDocumentOperations

        public DocumentOperation[] getDocumentOperations()
        A DocumentOperation takes one or more existing documents and uses them to create a set of new documents. A plugin may provide a number of document operations to Geneious, and each can have their own name and description.

        Refer to the information on Adding Functionality to see how to create a list of DocumentOperations.
        Returns:
        The DocumentOperations that the plugin provides.

      • getAlignmentOperations

        public AlignmentOperation[] getAlignmentOperations()
        A AlignmentOperation takes two or more existing sequences and aligns them. A plugin may provide a number of alignment operations to Geneious, and each can have their own name and description.
        Returns:
        The AlignmentOperations that the plugin provides.

      • getAssemblers

        public Assembler[] getAssemblers()
        A Assembler takes two or more existing sequences and assembles them. A plugin may provide a number of assembly algorithms to Geneious, and each can have their own name and description.
        Returns:
        The Assemblers that the plugin provides.
        Since:
        API 4.14 (Geneious 5.1)

      • getSequenceAnnotationGenerators

        public SequenceAnnotationGenerator[] getSequenceAnnotationGenerators()
        A SequenceAnnotationGenerator generates annotations on a sequence, set of sequences, or an alignment.

        Refer to the information on Adding Functionality to see how to create a list of AnnotationGenerators.
        Returns:
        A list of annotation generators.

      • getDocumentFileImporters

        public DocumentFileImporter[] getDocumentFileImporters()
        get the importers provided by this plugin.

        Refer to the information on Adding Functionality to see how to create a list of DocumentFileImporters.
        Returns:
        a list of importers which turn a document stored in a file into a geneious document. Cannot be null

      • getDocumentFileExporters

        public DocumentFileExporter[] getDocumentFileExporters()
        get the exporters provided by this plugin.

        Refer to the information on Adding Functionality to see how to create a list of DocumentFileExporters.
        Returns:
        a list of exporters which write a geneious document to a file. Cannot be null

      • getDocumentViewerFactories

        public DocumentViewerFactory[] getDocumentViewerFactories()
        A document viewer displays a set of documents in some graphically interesting way. A DocumentViewerFactory

        Refer to the information on Adding Functionality to see how to create a list of DocumentViewerFactories.
        Returns:
        A list of viewers. Cannot be null

      • getSequenceGraphFactories

        public SequenceGraphFactory[] getSequenceGraphFactories()
        A sequence graph displays a graph in the sequence viewer.
        Returns:
        A list of sequence graphs factories. Cannot be null

      • getDocumentActions

        public DocumentAction[] getDocumentActions()
        A DocumentAction is similar to a DocumentOperation, but it cannot create new documents. It is recommended that you use DocumentOperations instead of DocumentActions.

        Refer to the information on Adding Functionality to see how to create a list of DocumentActions.
        Returns:
        A list of actions. Cannot be null

      • getDocumentTypes

        public DocumentType[] getDocumentTypes()
        get possible document types.
        Returns:
        A list containing types of documents generated by the plugin. It is not required to "register" all your document types here, but unless you do so a user can't search for documents of that particular type in the advanced search. Cannot be null

      • getTreeViewerExtensionFactories

        public TreeViewerExtension.Factory[] getTreeViewerExtensionFactories()
        A TreeViewerExtension is used for creating a custom controls section in the tree viewer. The extension is able to interact with the tree by providing feedback based on selected nodes and is itself able to modify the selected nodes and/or the tree itself.
        Returns:
        tree viewer extension factories. cannot be null.

      • getSequenceViewerExtensionFactories

        public SequenceViewerExtension.Factory[] getSequenceViewerExtensionFactories()
        A SequenceViewerExtension is used for creating a custom extensions to the sequence viewer. For example statistics, custom components or custom actions.
        Returns:
        sequence viewer extension factories. cannot be null.
        Since:
        API 4.60 (Geneious 5.6.0)

      • getPreferences

        @Deprecated
public GeneiousPreferences getPreferences()
        Deprecated. GeneiousPreferences are the old style way of providing preferences. Use getPluginPreferences() instead which is more powerful and more consistent with other areas of the Geneious API.
        Get plugin preferences.
        Returns:
        plugin preferences or null if none.

      • getPluginPreferences

        public List<PluginPreferences> getPluginPreferences()
        Get a list of tabs to appear in the Geneious preferences window.
        Returns:
        a list of tabs to appear in the Geneious preferences window.

      • getIcons

        public Icons getIcons()
        get plugin icons set.
        Returns:
        The plugin icon. if null, a default icon is used.

      • getMinimumApiVersion

        public abstract String getMinimumApiVersion()
        Get the minimum required Geneious API version required for this plugin to operate. The API version is NOT the same as the Geneious version.
        Returns:
        the minimum required Geneious API version required for this plugin to operate. The current API version is defined in Geneious.getApiVersion() and is currently the version mentioned in the javadoc above ("4.912" as at 2016-02-24). You should only return something lower than this if you have tested with previous versions of Geneious.

      • getMaximumApiVersion

        public abstract int getMaximumApiVersion()
        Get the maximum major API version number (for example 4) which this plugin is known to work with. The API version is NOT the same as the Geneious version.
        Returns:
        a maximum major API version number (for example 4) which this plugin is known to work with. On very rare occasions (in fact, we hope never), we might break backwards compatibility, in which case the major API version number will change and users will be warned the plugin may not work. The current major API version number is 4 (which it has been since Geneious 3.6 through to Geneious 9.1 inclusive), so any implementations of this method should return 4 unless it has been tested with a later version of the Geneious PublicAPI.

      • addPluginChangedListener

        public final void addPluginChangedListener(SimpleListener listener)
        Adds a listener to be notified when this plugin changes any of the functionality (services, operations, importers etc) that it provides. The caller should discard the results of any previous calls to getDocumentOperations(), getServices() etc and call these methods again.

        This implementation is final. Sub-classes should use firePluginChangedListeners() to notify all listeners when they change their provided operations, services etc.

        Parameters:
        listener - the listener to be notified; must not be null
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if listener is null
        See Also:
        removePluginChangedListener(org.virion.jam.util.SimpleListener), firePluginChangedListeners()

      • removePluginChangedListener

        public final void removePluginChangedListener(SimpleListener listener)
        Remove a listener previously added using addPluginChangedListener(org.virion.jam.util.SimpleListener).
        Parameters:
        listener - the listener to no longer be notified
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if listener is null
        See Also:
        addPluginChangedListener(org.virion.jam.util.SimpleListener), firePluginChangedListeners()

      • firePluginChangedListeners

        protected final void firePluginChangedListeners()
        Sub-classes should use this method to notify all listeners added using addPluginChangedListener(org.virion.jam.util.SimpleListener) that they have change their provided operations, services etc.
        See Also:
        addPluginChangedListener(org.virion.jam.util.SimpleListener), removePluginChangedListener(org.virion.jam.util.SimpleListener)

      • getPluginLicenses

        public List<License.PluginLicense> getPluginLicenses()
        Provides a list of all the plugin licenses that are known to be used in this plugin. Any License.PluginLicense that is passed in to License.isPluginLicenseActive(GeneiousPlugin, com.biomatters.geneious.publicapi.plugin.License.PluginLicense, boolean))} must also be returned from this method.

        The default implementation returns an empty list.

        Returns:
        a list of all the plugin licenses that are known to be used in this plugin
        Since:
        API 4.40 (Geneious 5.4)

      • shutdown

        public void shutdown()
        Called when Geneious is shutting down all plugins, either because Geneious is shutting down or it is preparing to switch to a new data location
        Since:
        API 4.900 (Geneious 9.0.0)
